etymologies: mid 17th century; earliest use found in William Davenant (1606–1668), poet, playwright, and theatre manager. Either from French nerval from nerf nerve + -al, or from post-classical Latin nervalis from classical Latin nervus + -ālis

definitions: Of, relating to, or affecting the nerves.

notes.text: Now chiefly in English-language texts in publications from non-English-speaking countries.
